title: Absolute value

title: LHS
text: Now we have $$\frac{{\left(1-x\right)}^3}{\sqrt{1-x}}$$, which is equivalent to $$\frac{{\left(1-x\right)}^3}{{\left(1-x\right)}^{\frac{1}{2}}}$$ after converting radicals to exponents.
speech: Now we have  fraction, parentheses 1 minus x,  cubed, over, the square root of 1 minus x end root  , which is equivalent to  fraction, parentheses 1 minus x,  cubed, over, parentheses 1 minus x,  raised to the 1 half power   after converting radicals to exponents.
pacedSpeech: Now we have   fraction,  1 minus x,  cubed, over, the square root of 1 minus x end root
, which is equivalent to   fraction,  1 minus x,  cubed, over,  1 minus x,  raised to the 1 half power

title: LHS
speech: Since  fraction, a to the b-th, over, a to the c-th,  is equal to a raised to the b minus c power ,  fraction, parentheses 1 minus x,  cubed, over, parentheses 1 minus x,  raised to the 1 half power  is equal to parentheses 1 minus x,  raised to the 3 minus 1 half power is equal to parentheses 1 minus x,  raised to the 5 halves power .
pacedSpeech: Since   fraction, a to the b-th, over, a to the c-th,  is equal to a raised to the b minus c power

title: Simplification
